Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Goblet
Description: Tall conical goblet with a slightly unrestricted mouth, simple lip and small flat base. Both surfaces were burnished, which resulted in visible marks on the inside (black). The outside, more carefully burnished, bears a pale red-brown slip upon which a red geometrical pattern was applied. This design consist of four adjacent registers composed of triangles filled with diagonal lines, on top of a series of horizontal brush strokes.
